title: 103_s1428
content: The "Women and HIV Outreach and Prevention Act" is cited as the short title. It amends Title XXV of the Public Health Service Act to include preventive health programs for women regarding HIV. This includes providing preventive health services. The Secretary may grant funds for preventive health services related to HIV for women, including counseling, screening, and referrals for treatment, substance abuse, mental health, pregnancy, childbirth, pediatric care, and housing services. The Secretary may grant funds for preventive health services related to HIV for women, including counseling, screening, treatment referrals, substance abuse, mental health, pregnancy, childbirth, pediatric care, housing services, follow-up services, improving referral arrangements, providing services to partners, outreach services, and training provision. The Secretary may grant funds for preventive health services related to HIV for women, including counseling, screening, treatment referrals, and maintaining confidentiality of individual information. Applicants must meet specific qualifications and agree to comply with applicable laws. The Secretary will conduct evaluations of projects and submit reports to Congress annually. Appropriations are authorized for grants to Title X clinics and other purposes under subsection (a). Authorized appropriations of $30,000,000 for fiscal year 1994 and necessary sums for 1995 and 1996 for grants under section 1001. Additionally, $20,000,000 for fiscal year 1994 and necessary sums for 1995 and 1996 for grants to entities under sections 329 or 330 and other entities described in subsection (b). Additionally, $20,000,000 for fiscal year 1994 and necessary sums for 1995 and 1996 for grants to entities under sections 329 or 330 and other entities described in subsection (b). SEC. 2532. PUBLIC EDUCATION." The Secretary may grant funds to educate women on AIDS prevention, with priority for entities targeting women of color. Applicants must be experienced in women's health activities. Grant applications must meet specified requirements. The Secretary will conduct evaluations of projects funded under subsection (a) and submit annual reports to Congress. $30,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1994, with additional funding for 1995 and 1996. SEC. 3. Treatment of women for substance abuse. Subpart 1 of part B of title V of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include a new section on the treatment of women for substance abuse. The Director of the Center for Substance Abuse Treatment may award grants, agreements, and contracts to provide substance abuse treatment for women, including those with dependent children. Counseling on AIDS prevention is also included for women and their partners. $20,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 1994, with additional funding for 1995 and 1996. SEC. 4. EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES FOR WOMEN. Amends the Public Health Service Act to provide grants for early intervention services for women, with $20,000,000 authorized for fiscal year 1994 and additional funding for 1995 and 1996.
